campaign.name: THALYVE-SMS-TEST-01
campaign.targeting: Fully broad — NO age, NO gender, NO interests. Advantage+ does ALL targeting.

dailyData.notes: Day 1 - launch day. 48hr no-touch. Algorithm learning.
Day 2 - still in 48hr no-touch window. 3 ATCs, 2 checkouts total.

decisionLog.reasoning: Warmup complete (40hrs). 9 ads active. Advantage+ Sales, CBO $100/day. Fully broad targeting. 48hr no-touch rule starts now.
48hr no-touch rule — do NOT adjust anything until Mar 1. Let Meta's algorithm learn.

Day 1-2 data review. $115.06 spent, 87 clicks, 2.96% CTR (excellent — above 1.5% target), 3 ATCs, 2 checkouts initiated. CTR shows creatives are hooking people. Funnel is converting clicks → ATCs → checkouts. Still inside 48hr no-touch window. Algorithm is learning. DO NOT ADJUST.

Creative analysis: 2.96% CTR across all 3 ad sets is strong for Day 1-2 cold traffic. This means the hooks are working — people are stopping and clicking. 3 ATCs and 2 checkout initiations from 87 clicks = 3.4% ATC rate (decent for cold). No creative kills needed yet. Need per-ad-set breakdown on Mar 1 to identify which of the 3 creative types (UGC/Demo/Problem-Solution) is driving the most ATCs.

Need Anton to screenshot the AD SET level breakdown on Mar 1 (not just campaign level). This lets me see which of the 3 ad sets is spending most efficiently, which creatives have highest CTR, and where the ATCs are coming from. Campaign-level data is good for overview but I need ad-set granularity for kill/scale decisions.

product: All ad sets killed → KILL product
No path to B/E ROAS (1.31×) → KILL product
